content: One of the keys for me with any task that requires an extra level of self-motivation (exercise, writing, etc), is making the decision ahead of time. Committing to myself that I’m going to exercise tomorrow morning, or I’m going to write the outline for a new article on Saturday. The trap is when that decision making process is left to the moment-of. If you’re in bed and debating about whether today is the right day to get up and exercise, your brain will come up with plenty of reasons why it’s not. You’re in a “weakened” state of mind, surrounded by a comfortable alternative. If you can make those internal commitments when you’re feeling strong, you remove the decision point completely. You’re already committed — you can just go.
